newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares dip in low volume market up to FOMC.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares dip in low volume market up to FOMC.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower on Monday in a market suffering from low volume trade and cautious ahead of the U.S. FOMC meeting starting Tuesday.
"The FOMC meeting will also inhibit the market again tomorrow and the way Wall Street performs tonight will influence things too," one dealer said.
The Dow Jones slipped from the opening. The Danish market was focused on a few KFX shares only, notably Tele Danmark, ISS and Danisco.
The KFX top-20 index lost 0.30 point to 122.05 while the KFX December future remained untraded at 123.15.
Tele Danmark was the day's most popular paper with some 90,000 shares changing hands to finish one crown lower only at 278, while Danisco shed one crown too to end at 325.
ISS dropped one crown to close at 149 and Den Danske Bank finished two crowns down at 424, with rival Unibank one lower at 273. Bucking the trend Radiometer completed the day unchanged at 360.
Overall turnover for the day was 608 million crowns.
